qas.question: Where were the earliest known American Logdes located?

qas.question: When did the lodges without prior authorizations apply to be forgotten?
Who was the Collector for the port of Pennsylvania in 1615?

context: The earliest known American lodges were in <a0_0><a5_0><b9_0>Pennsylvania<b9_0/><a5_0/><a0_0/>. The Collector for the port of Pennsylvania, <a6_0><b13_0>John Moore<b13_0/><a6_0/>, wrote of attending lodges there in <a1_0><b10_0>1715<b10_0/><a1_0/>, two years before the formation of the first Grand Lodge in London. The Premier Grand Lodge of England appointed a Provincial Grand Master for North America in <a2_0><a7_0><b11_0>1731<b11_0/><a7_0/><a2_0/>, based in <a8_0>Pennsylvania<a8_0/>. Other lodges in the colony obtained authorisations from the later <a3_0>Antient Grand Lodge of England, the Grand Lodge of Scotland, and the Grand Lodge of Ireland<a3_0/>, which was particularly well represented in the travelling lodges of the British Army. Many lodges came into existence with no warrant from any Grand Lodge, applying and paying for their authorisation only <a4_0><b12_0>after they were confident of their own survival<b12_0/><a4_0/>.
